div.p:
unlucky illness kept us so long that he was obliged to go on about
his own pursuits & leave us to our less useful objects - & now we
only see him here for a few days as our journey home will be circuitous
on account of various visits & slow on account of Maria's health, as though
recovered she is still very weak . . Sally, will I am sure enjoy the
Highlands & perhaps feel too much afterwards that Her heart's in the Highlands &c.
But I feel now that I have been long enough away indeed two months from
home is nearly enough to bring on at least a slight fit of the mal du pays.
div.closer:
Always yours most gratefully & affectionately
Harriet Edgeworth
Thursday

postscript.p:
sights which do not occur so naturally as the Bank & the College in Dublin
Here you will have much to see and all of it most interesting. One
can hardly be an hour in Sir Walters Scotts company without at once seeing
the mind that produced all from Waverley to - Quentin Durward - Of course
one never alludes to them in his presence, but he often mentions them
himself with a most careless & easy impudence.
I send this by WmWilliam who will tell you much more - we
had not the delight of having him during our whole journey as Marias
